Instruction: In the file "IJ56KL.pdf", on page 15, within the first rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Load, Type, Value"; second row "Dead, Uniform, 10kN/m"; third row "Live, Point, 5kN".
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "IJ56KL.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 14  # Page 15 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 0  # First rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Load", "Type", "Value"], ["Dead", "Uniform", "10kN/m"], ["Live", "Point", "5kN"]]
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

# Page-level and order-level extraction
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Assuming the fourth rectangle is on the first page (default if not specified)
pagenumber = 0  # Default to first page if not mentioned
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle, 0-indexed

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
except Exception as e:
    # In case the rectangle does not exist or index is out of range
    missing_information = '''file-level:OP12QR.pdf, page-level: 0, order-level: 3, base-level: "add a table with the following content: first row "Joint, Type, Load"; second row "J1, Fixed, 10 kN"; third row "J2, Pinned, 5 kN"; adjust the row heights to [30, 25, 25] and set the font size to 12."'''
    recorder = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information)

    # Save updated file

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "GH56IJ.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level information

# Rectangle 3
rectangleorder1 = 2  # Third rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle for Rectangle 3
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# First table content for Rectangle 3
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    data=[
        ["Member ID", "Length", "Material"],
        ["M001", "5 m", "Steel"],
        ["M002", "7 m", "Concrete"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [70, 70, 80]],  # Adjusting column widths appropriately
    fontsize=11  # Standard font size
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    arrange=argument1.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument1.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

# Rectangle 5
rectangleorder2 = 4  # Fifth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle for Rectangle 5
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Second table content for Rectangle 5
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    data=[
        ["Joint ID", "Type", "Load Capacity"],
        ["J001", "Fixed", "10 kN"],
        ["J002", "Pinned", "5 kN"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [70, 70, 80]],  # Adjusting column widths suitably
    fontsize=11  # Standard font size
)

# Adding the second table

    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    arrange=argument2.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument2.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "IJ56KL.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 11  # Page 12 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 8  # Ninth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# First table content
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Area", "Function", "Occupancy"],
        ["A1", "Lobby", "50 people"],
        ["A2", "Conference Room", "100 people"]
    ],
    arrange=[[30, 25, 25], None]  # Adjusting row heights
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    arrange=argument1.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

# Second table content
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Fire Exit", "Width", "Location"],
        ["Exit 1", "1.5m", "North"],
        ["Exit 2", "1.5m", "South"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [70, 50, 60]],  # Column widths
    fontsize=12  # Standard font size
)

# Adding the second table
table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    arrange=argument2.get("arrange"),
    fontsize=argument2.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

    data=[

        ["Steel", "7,850 kg/m³", "$500/ton"],

)
doc1 = table_adder1.addtable()

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1
# File-level
filepath = "ZT56PQ.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level
pagenumber = 11  # page 12 corresponds to index 11
# Order-level
rectangleorder = 2  # third rectangle corresponds to index 2

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
    argument = dict(clip=rectangle)
    
    # Extract original table
    table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument["clip"])
    table_data = table_extractor.data
    
    # Update table: delete entire table
    table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument["clip"], data=table_data)
    table_manipulator.data = table_manipulator.cuttable()  # Delete entire table
    doc = table_manipulator.addtable()

    # Save updated file
    updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
    doc.save(updated_file)

except Exception as e:
    # In case any error occurs (e.g., missing rectangle), record as incomplete
    missing_information = '''file-level: ZT56PQ.pdf, page-level: 12, order-level: 3, base-level: delete the entire table (incomplete)'''
    recorder = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information)
    recorder.recording

import PDFbf

# Task 1
# File-level
filepath = "GT34MN.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level
pagenumber = 9  # Page 10 corresponds to index 9
# Order-level
rectangleorder = 4  # Fifth rectangle corresponds to index 4

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
except Exception as e:
    # If rectangle extraction fails due to invalid order, record missing order-level info
    missing_information = '''file-level: GT34MN.pdf, page-level: 10, order-level: 5, base-level: delete the rows 4, 5, and 6 from the table. Apply alignment to "justify" and set the border width to 1.0. (incomplete)'''

    }

    table_manipulator.data = table_manipulator.cuttable(delrow=[4, 5, 6])

    )

argument0 = dict(clip=rectangle0, font="Helvetica-Bold", fontsize=11, align="left")  # "moderately formal and slightly bold" → Helvetica-Bold assumed
table_extractor0 = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber0, clip=argument0["clip"])
table_data0 = table_extractor0.data
table_manipulator0 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber0,
    clip=argument0["clip"],
    data=table_data0,
    font=argument0.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument0.get("fontsize"),
    align=argument0.get("align")
)

# Replace entire table

table_manipulator0.data = table_manipulator0.modifytable(repdata=repdata0)

# Delete 2nd column
table_manipulator0.data = table_manipulator0.cuttable(delcolumn=[2])

# Clear cells from 2nd row, 1st column to 5th row, 3rd column (after column deletion, adjust indices accordingly)
# But since we are processing sequentially, we must consider operations are applied on the current state.
# However, the instruction order implies: replace → delete column → clear range.
# After deleting column 2, original 3-column table becomes 2 columns. So clearing up to column 3 is invalid.
# But per instruction flow, the "clear" operation likely refers to original layout. Since we cannot reliably map post-delete,
# and instruction order is ambiguous, we assume operations are applied in the order given, on the current data.

# So after replacing and deleting column 2, the table has 1 column.
# Now trying to clear from [2,1] to [5,3] → column 3 doesn't exist. So we clear only valid range: [2,1] to [5,1] if rows exist.

# To follow instruction literally, we should reorder operations: do clear *before* delete, unless specified.
# But instruction says: "Replace... Delete... Clear..." → so order is: replace → delete → clear.

# After delete, only column 1 remains. So we clear from row 2 to 5, column 1.
# Check if table has at least 5 rows after replace
if len(table_manipulator0.data) >= 2:
    table_manipulator0.data = table_manipulator0.emptytable(startcell=[2, 1], endcell=[5, 1])
else:
    # If fewer than 2 rows, clearing from row 2 may not apply
    pass

doc = table_manipulator0.addtable()

    print(f"Error opening file: {e}")
    exit()

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level
pagenumber = 9  # page 10 corresponds to index 9
# Order-level
rectangleorder = 3  # fourth rectangle corresponds to index 3

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
except Exception as e:
    # If position extraction fails due to missing annotation
    missing_information = '''file-level: PR45UV.pdf, page-level: 10, order-level: 4, base-level: clear all cells starting from the 3rd row and 2nd column to the 5th row and 6th column. Use a casual font style with an indeterminate size. (incomplete)'''
    recorder = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information)
    recorder.recording
else:
    # Base-level operation
    # Argument collection
    argument = {"clip": rectangle, "font": "casual"}  # font specified as "casual", but no standard "casual" font; will pass as-is
    # Font size is indeterminate -> not specified, so omit from args

    try:
        table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument["clip"])
        table_data = table_extractor.data
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error extracting table: {e}")
        table_data = []

    # Initialize manipulator
    table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
        doc=doc,

        data=table_data,
        font=argument.get("font"),  # optional: "casual"
        fontsize=argument.get("fontsize"),  # None, since size is indeterminate
        align=argument.get("align"),
        borderwidth=argument.get("borderwidth")
    )

    # Perform clear operation
    table_manipulator.data = table_manipulator.emptytable(startcell=[3, 2], endcell=[5, 6])

    # Add updated table back
    doc = table_manipulator.addtable()

    # Save updated file
    updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
    doc.save(updated_file)

# Task 1
# File-level
filepath = "De222lsfqweete_table.pdf"  # Assuming the file name from previous context since not specified in current instruction
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level
pagenumber = 8  # Page 9 corresponds to index 8 (zero-based)
# Order-level
rectangleorder = 0  # First rectangle corresponds to index 0
try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
except Exception as e:
    # If rectangle extraction fails due to invalid page or order, record missing information
    missing_information = '''file-level: De222lsfqweete_table.pdf, page-level:9, order-level:0, base-level: Clear the entire table. Replace it with: "Header1, Header2," and "Data1, Data2." Use a soft font type with an unspecified size. (incomplete)'''
    recorder = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information)
    recorder.recording
else:
    # Base-level: Operation is fully specified
    argument = {"clip": rectangle, "font": "soft"}  # "soft" interpreted as requested font type; no size provided
    table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=rectangle)
    table_data = table_extractor.data

    table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=rectangle, data=table_data, font=argument.get("font"))

    # Clear entire table
    table_manipulator.data = table_manipulator.emptytable()

    # Replace with new data
    repdata = [["Header1", "Header2"], ["Data1", "Data2"]]
    table_manipulator.data = table_manipulator.modifytable(repdata=repdata)

    # Add updated table back to document
    doc = table_manipulator.addtable()

argument = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "font": "Arial",
    "fontsize": None,  # Not specified in instruction
    "borderwidth": 1.5,
    "align": "center"
}

# Extract original table data (to be replaced)

repdata = [
    ["ID", "Name", "Age"],
    ["101", "Alice", "23"],
    ["102", "Bob", "27"],

]

)

import fitz
import PDFbf


# Task 1
# File-level
filepath = "QW8RT6.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level
pagenumber = 7  # page 8 corresponds to index 7
# Order-level
rectangleorder = 1  # second rectangle corresponds to index 1

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
except Exception as e:
    # If rectangle extraction fails due to invalid order or page, record missing order-level info
    missing_information = '''file-level: QW8RT6.pdf, page-level: 8, order-level: missing, base-level: clear all cells in the range starting from the 3rd row and 2nd column, ending at the 6th row and 4th column. Set the font size to 12 and align the content to "left."'''
    recorder = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information=missing_information)
    recorder.recording
else:
    # Base-level: Operation is fully specified
    argument = {
        "clip": rectangle,
        "fontsize": 12,
        "align": "left"
    }
    
    table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument["clip"])
    table_data = table_extractor.data
    
    table_manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
        doc=doc,
        pagenumber=pagenumber,
        clip=argument["clip"],
        data=table_data,
        fontsize=argument["fontsize"],
        align=argument["align"]
    )
    
    # Clear the specified cell range: from [3,2] to [6,4]
    table_manipulator.data = table_manipulator.emptytable(startcell=[3, 2], endcell=[6, 4])
    
    # Apply the updated table back to the document
    doc = table_manipulator.addtable()

    # Save the updated file
    updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
    doc.save(updated_file)

# Task 1
# File-level
filepath = "ZT56PQ.pdf"

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level

# Order-level

try:
    rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)
    argument = dict(clip=rectangle)
    
    # Extract original table data (required as input even if we are deleting)
    table_extractor = PDFbf.extract_table(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument["clip"])
